intro: Barleria prinoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of pink or purple. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms. Barleria prinoides thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it suitable for gardens and landscaping.
